III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date during the summer of 2025, a staff member
would allow 4 youth to hit a vape. The staff member would take
the youth on drives and go to the staff member's apartment. The
staff member would supply the youth with marijuana within their
apartment.
Additional Allegation: Staff provided vapes to youth at the
facility.
Investigation MDHHS Worker 2 was interviewed via telephone on 8/19/2025.
MDHHS Worker 2 reported she interviewed Youth A who reported
Staff 1 took her, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D to her apartment
and let Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D smoke marijuana and
Youth A use her vape. MDHHS Worker 2 reported Youth A stated
while at Staff 1’s apartment in Copper Beech Staff 1, Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C watched tv. Youth A reported this occurred
while they were supposed to be on a therapeutic drive. MDHHS
Worker 2 reported Youth A stated Collateral lived with Staff 1 and
Collateral was at the apartment while this occurred. Youth A
reported they were at Staff 1’s apartment for approximately one
hour and drove there in the facility’s silver Ford Fusion.
2

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at school on 8/21/2025
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth B reported the
facility stopped allowing therapeutic drives three weeks ago.
Youth B reported therapeutic drives were when a staff would take
a few youth for a fifteen-to-twenty-minute drive when a youth
needed a break from the house. Youth B reported she went on
approximately five to six therapeutic drives while placed at the
facility with varying staff, including Staff 1. Youth B reported she
has been on therapeutic drives with different youth including
Youth C, Youth D, Youth F, and believed once with Youth A.
Youth B reported she has gone to the park once with Staff 1 and
she believed Youth C. Youth B reported no staff have ever taken
her to their house or apartment, including Staff 1. Youth B
reported no staff or youth have ever vaped while on a therapeutic
drive. Youth B reported she smokes marijuana and the last time
she smoked marijuana was prior to coming to the facility. Youth B
reported no knowledge of any staff ever giving any youth vapes at
the facility. Youth B reported Youth D did have a vape while at the
facility that she had snuck in from a home pass. Youth B reported
she used Youth D’s vape once or twice and Youth D gave her the
vape which staff found and took from her. Youth B reported a peer
who is no longer at the facility was spreading a rumor that she got
the vape from a staff however Youth B reported she did not, a
staff had the same name as Youth D and she obtained the vape
from Youth D. Youth B reported she was aware that Staff 1 lives
at Copper Beech as Staff 1 brought in an air freshener with
Copper Beech name on and told her that was where she got it.
Youth B reported Staff 1 took her, Youth C, and another youth,
unable to recall who, to the gym at Copper Beech to work out one
time and denied any youth vaping or using marijuana during the
outing. Youth B reported she has met Collateral as Collateral has
come to the facility to drop Staff 1 off and pick Staff 1 up from
work as well as once at the park. Youth B reported the times she
has seen Collateral it has been quick situations where they have
said “hi” and “bye”.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
8/21/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1 and via
telephone on 8/22/2025. Youth C reported the facility used to
have therapeutic drives, however the facility stopped allowing
therapeutic drives about two to three weeks ago. Youth C
reported therapeutic drives were used when a youth was
escalated and needed to get a break from the house and a staff
would take the youth and two other youth for a fifteen-minute
drive. However, the therapeutic drives ended as youth were taking
3

advantage of them. Youth C reported she has gone on several
therapeutic drives as she has been placed at the facility for nearly
a year. Youth C reported she has been on therapeutic drives with
several staff from the facility including Staff 1. Youth C reported
Staff 1 is nice and “does her job right” which Youth C described as
Staff 1 being structured and setting expectations. Youth C
reported youth at the facility tend to go to Staff 1 as Staff 1 listens
to youth and understands the youth. Youth C reported when she
has been on therapeutic drives with Staff 1 they drive around for
approximately fifteen minutes. Youth C reported she has never
stopped anywhere while on a therapeutic drive with Staff 1. Youth
C reported she has never been to any staff’s house and/or
apartments. Youth C reported Staff 2 told Staff 1 to take some of
the youth to Copper Beech gym and Staff 1 told Staff 2 she lived
there and did not want to go due to that being where she lived.
Youth C reported she has met Collateral when Collateral has
dropped Staff 1 off at work or picked Staff 1 up from work. Youth
C reported the only communication she has ever had with
Collateral is to say hi/bye. Youth C reported she has seen Staff 1’s
dog when Collateral had Staff 1’s dog in the car and was dropping
Staff 1 off at work. Youth C reported she has never seen any
youth or staff smoke or vape including while on therapeutic drives
however when interviewed on a separate date (8/22/2025) Youth
C reported Staff 5 allowed her to vape and brought in a vape for
Youth D as well as Staff 4 would vape and smoke weed pens in
front of youth, unable to recall specifically which youth, at the
facility. Youth C reported Staff 2 dropped a “weed pen” in front of
her while at the movies. Youth C reported she knew it was a
“weed pen” because she used to use one. Youth C reported on
8/21/2025 no staff at the facility have ever offered her to smoke,
vape, or use marijuana however on 8/22/2025 reported Staff 5
allowed her to vape. Youth C reported Youth A never smoked
when Youth A was at the facility however Youth A got “shrooms”
from school. Youth C reported Youth D would get vapes and weed
pens from school when she was placed at the facility. Youth C
reported she got mad at Staff 1 and thought about making up lies
to get Staff 1 in trouble, however she decided not to. Youth C
denied saying anything about going on outings and Staff 1
allowing her to vape. Youth C denied ever having a conversation
with Youth E regarding inquiring if Youth E would tell on a staff for
letting them smoke/vape.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
8/21/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1 and via
telephone on 9/15/2025. Administrator 1 reported no knowledge
of the allegations. Administrator 1 reported youth at the facility
4

respect Staff 1 and Staff 1 “sticks to the schedule”. Administrator 1
reported Staff 1 leads shifts at the facility as she does her job well
and knows the expectations. Administrator 1 reported the facility
has “dialed back” on therapeutic drives. Administrator 1 reported
she has no knowledge as to how youth would know where Staff 1
lives. Administrator 1 reported Collateral drops Staff 1 off and
picks Staff 1 up from work as well as has come to the facility for
an application for employment however was not hired.
Administrator 1 reported Collateral does not come into the facility
or have contact with the youth when she drops and picks up Staff
1. Administrator 1 reported no knowledge of any staff using a vape
in front of youth or any staff having any vapes or “weed pens” on
their person while working. No youth have ever reported any
incidents to her regarding this. Administrator 1 reported Staff 4 nor
Staff 9 ever came and reported Youth A had reached out and
reported concerns to Staff 4 regarding Staff 1 taking youth to her
apartment and allowing youth to vape and/or smoke marijuana.
Administrator 1 reported the facility did not use Morey Courts from
May through the first week in September due to confusion about
the membership. Administrator 1 reported the facility began using
Planet Fitness around June 2025 as the youth were able to go for
free over the summer. Administrator 1 reported Youth C did on
accident break Staff 5’s windshield as she was playing catch with
a ball and that it was not in attempt to get a vape from Staff 5’s
car. Administrator 1 reported Staff 5 attempted to carry her purse
that was a cross-body bag on shift at the house as she wanted to
have her cellphone in the event of an emergency however based
on safety concerns for the cross-body bag being a strangulation
hazard, Staff 5 was told to lock her purse up. Administrator 1
reported Staff 5 locking her purse up had nothing to do with her
having a vape.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
8/21/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1 and via
telephone on 9/10/2025 and 9/15/2025. Administrator 2 reported
Youth E came to her as Youth E was upset with Staff 1 and told
Administrator 2 Youth C asked her if she would “rat” on a staff for
lighting up. Administrator 2 reported she asked what “lighting up”
meant and Youth E reported smoking a cigarette. Administrator 2
reported she talked to Youth B and Youth C and both youth
denied this. Administrator 2 reported she spoke with Staff 3 who
typically works with Staff 1 to see if Staff 3 had any concerns
regarding Staff 1 and Staff 3 did not. Administrator 2 reported no
one has ever reported or verbalized any concerns of youth coming
back to the facility appearing to be “high”. Administrator 2 reported
Staff 1 has been doing well leading shifts at the facility.
5

Administrator 2 reported Staff 2 approved for staff to take youth to
Copper Beech gym once as Staff 2 reported the gym was open to
the public however Administrator 2 reported she did not know
what youth or staff went. Administrator 2 reported no knowledge of
any staff using a vape in front of youth or any staff having any
vapes or “weed pens” on their person while working and that no
youth have ever reported any incidents to her regarding this.
Administrator 2 reported no knowledge or any youth reporting
Staff 4 vaping in front of youth and/or using a marijuana vape pen
in front of youth, Staff 5 allowing Youth C to vape or bringing in a
vape for Youth D, or Staff 6 allowing Youth C to use her vape.
Administrator 2 reported no knowledge of Staff 1 contacting
Collateral to assist in putting coolant in the facility vehicle.
Administrator 2 reported in the summer of 2024 the facilities Ford
Fusion vehicle had the light come on once indicating the car was
overheating which was due to a malfunction with the coolant cap
which the facility replaced. Administrator 2 reported in the
spring/early summer 2025 the light came on again and
maintenance took the Ford Fusion back into the dealership to
have the issue addressed. Administrator 2 reported staff are to
contact the maintenance worker whenever there is an issue with a
vehicle for maintenance to address the issue. Administrator 2
reported Staff 4 nor Staff 9 ever came and reported Youth A had
reached out and reported concerns to Staff 4 regarding Staff 1
taking youth to her apartment and allowing youth to vape and/or
smoke marijuana. Administrator 2 reported staff posted in the
group chat at the facility about using Copper Beech gym at which
time administrator posted in the group chat only authorized gyms
could be utilized, however it was not related to any concerns of
any staff taking youth to their apartment or related to the
allegations.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 3. Youth D reported she
was “close” with Staff 1 and she has never seen or heard any
youth state Staff 1 has smoked anything around them. Youth D
reported she has never seen Staff 1 with a vape nor has Staff 1
ever provided any youth with a vape. Youth D reported while she
was placed at the facility she went on therapeutic drives which
included going on short drives and on a few occasions they would
go to the park and Planet Fitness. Youth D reported she went on
therapeutic drives with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C while
placed at the facility however did not recall specific times or where
they went. Youth D reported she never went to Copper Beech.
Youth D reported she was familiar with Copper Beech as she had
a friend from school that lived there however, she had never been
6

there. Youth D reported she did not know where any staff from the
facility lived, nor had she ever gone to any staff’s
houses/apartments. Youth D reported Collateral is Staff 1’s
partner and Collateral would drive Staff 1 to work and pick Staff 1
up from work. Youth D reported youth at the facility were not
allowed to talk to Collateral other than to say “hi”. Youth D denied
ever going to Staff 1’s house/apartment. Youth D reported Staff 6
used to work at the facility and would allow youth to use her vape.
Youth D reported she never used Staff 6’s vape and never saw
any youth use Staff 6’s vape however heard about it, unable to
recall from who. Youth D reported she heard Youth C and Youth
G used Staff 6’s vape, however did not recall when and reported
Children’s Protective Services was involved in the incident. Youth
D reported no knowledge of any other staff providing youth vapes
at the facility.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth E reported the
facility used to have therapeutic drives, however the facility
recently stopped doing them, Youth E was unsure why. Youth E
reported she had gone on therapeutic drives with Staff 1 and they
stopped at the gas station to get a drink and drove around. Youth
E reported Staff 1 showed her the apartment complex she lives in
but not the specific unit and described the complex as being near
Walmart as Staff 1 wanted to look at something, unknown what.
Youth E reported they pulled into the apartment complex parking
lot and turned around and left. Youth E reported no knowledge of
Staff 1 or any staff ever taking any youth to their house/apartment.
Youth E reported staff smoke vapes/cigarettes off the property
behind the trees sometimes at work. Youth E reported she has
never seen Staff 1 smoke anything, however Youth E reported
Staff 1 has come into work smelling of cigarette smoke and
marijuana. Youth E reported she did not want to answer if she
has ever seen any staff smoke cigarettes or vape while off
grounds. Youth E reported no staff have ever offered her anything
including vapes/cigarettes/marijuana. Youth E reported she has
heard rumors around the facility, however Youth E reported she
did not know if the rumors were true, so she did not want to
elaborate. Youth E reported Youth C told her Staff 1 let Youth C
smoke however Youth C did not specify what allegedly Staff 1 let
her smoke. Youth E reported Youth C was mad at Staff 1 and
Youth C asked Youth E if she would tell on a staff for letting youth
smoke. Youth E reported Youth F took her outside and told her
not to say anything about Staff 1 letting them smoke and that Staff
1 is a good staff and they don’t want her fired. Youth E reported
she told this information to Administrator 2 when she was mad at
7

Staff 1. Youth E reported to her knowledge based on hearsay
Staff 1 let Youth B, Youth C, and Youth F smoke based on what
Youth C told her and Youth F told her not to tell.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she was
made aware of the allegations of he allegedly taking youth to her
apartment and providing youth with vapes and marijuana as
Administrator 2 informed her as well as youth at the facility. Staff
1 reported she does not know why someone would make these
allegations. Staff 1 denied the allegations. Staff 1 reported
Collateral drops her off at work and picks her up from work and
her dog has been in the car at times where the youth have seen
her dog from the car. Staff 1 reported she has never provided
Collateral with any information regarding the youth and Collateral
does not know any of the youth’s names, the only contact
Collateral has had with any youth at the facility is “hi/bye”
communication. Staff 1 reported when she first began working at
the facility the facility was using Copper Beech gym and when she
was taking Youth A, Youth C, and Youth D she saw Collateral
outside with her dog and she stopped the vehicle and said “that’s
my dog”. Staff 1 reported she does live at Copper Beech and
when the youth asked to go to the gym at Copper Beech, she said
she lived there as the apartment complex is large, and she did not
say which unit she resided in. Staff 1 reported when she drove
past and said “that’s my dog, she reported she nor the youth got
out of the vehicle, nor did she take the youth to her apartment, nor
did she provide any youth with vapes or marijuana.
Staff 1 reported she holds the youth accountable at the facility and
does not understand where the allegations are coming from. Staff
1 reported Youth C got mad at her three weeks ago and Youth C
said she was going to get her in trouble and get her fired. Staff 1
reported Youth C went and told Youth E something to the effect of
“if you knew a staff was giving vapes to a youth would you tell on
them to get them fired” and Youth E asked if it was Staff 1 and
then went and told Staff 1 what Youth C said. Staff 1 reported
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 talked to her and asked her if
she had ever provided vapes to any youth and Staff 1 told
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 that she had never done that.
Staff 1 reported when Youth A left the facility; Youth A made a
comment that she was going to get Staff 1 in trouble however
Staff 1 reported she did not know why as she had gotten along
well with Youth A. Staff 1 reported she took youth, different youth
at different times, approximately four to five times to Copper
Beech gym between April/May 2025 with Staff 2’s approval as
8

Staff 2 was the lead on shifts. Staff 1 reported she does not even
vape as she smokes cigarettes. Staff 1 reported she does not
have any knowledge of any staff providing vapes to the youth at
the facility nor have any youth ever reported any concerns to her.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth F reported she has
never been on any therapeutic drives while at the facility nor has
she ever been to a place called Copper Beech. Youth F reported
she has gone to the park a few times with Staff 1, Youth B, and
Youth C. Youth F reported she has never seen Collateral at the
park. Youth F reported she has seen Collateral when Collateral
has dropped Staff 1 off at work however Youth F did not know
Collateral’s name and reported never having any contact with
Collateral. Youth F reported she has never been to Staff 1’s
house/apartment. Youth F reported Youth C got mad at Staff 1
recently and Youth C stated she was going to get Staff 1 in
trouble. Youth F denied ever telling a peer not to tell anything
about Staff 1 as she did not want Staff 1 to get fired. Youth F
reported no staff at the facility have ever provided her or any of
the youth at the facility with vapes or marijuana. Youth F reported
no concerns with Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via video conference on 8/22/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported the facility
does recreation and goes to the park and gym including Morey
Courts, Planet Fitness, and Copper Beech was approved while
Morey Courts was closed for a short period and prior to the facility
having a Planet Fitness membership. Staff 2 reported the facility
utilized Copper Beech gym during the springtime (April to May) as
it was a gym that was open to the public for free. Staff 2 reported
Copper Beech no longer is approved by the facility as Staff 1 now
lives at the apartment complex connected to Copper Beech. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 informed him that she lived at Copper Beech so
he recommended she no longer take the youth there. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 initially took the youth to Copper Beech when she
first began working at the facility prior to him being aware she
lived in the apartment complex and once she told Staff 2 she lived
in the apartment complex he advised she no longer take them.
Staff 2 reported no youth ever stated they had been to her
apartment or any concerns. Staff 2 reported once he learned Staff
1 lived in the apartment complex, he just talked to her about
making sure youth do not know where she lives however, he did
not have any concerns that she had. Staff 2 reported no
knowledge of any staff including Staff 1, providing any youth with
vapes or marijuana. Staff 2 reported he has no concerns with Staff
9

1. Staff 2 reported no knowledge of Youth C recently being
mad/upset with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported he used to work with Staff
6 who’s no longer employed at the facility. Staff 2 reported Staff
6’s daughter went to school with Youth C and Staff 6 allowed her
daughter to vape. Staff 2 reported during that time period it
seemed there were a lot of vapes coming into the facility from
hearsay amongst staff however Staff 2 reported he did not recall
who he heard it from. Staff 2 reported he never heard any specific
concerns regarding Staff 6 providing vapes or Staff 6’s daughter
giving vapes to the youth at school, however it just seemed odd to
him that there appeared to be in influx in youth coming back from
school with vapes.
Collateral was interviewed via telephone on 8/27/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Collateral reported she
sometimes drops and picks up Staff 1 from work. Collateral
reported at times youth from the facility will run out to greet Staff 1
when she has dropped Staff 1 off at work and she has said “hi” to
the youth and then leaves. Collateral reported once she was out
walking with Staff 1’s dog and Staff 1 drove by with some youth in
the vehicle on their way to the gym. Staff 1 stopped briefly so the
youth could see their dog. Collateral reported the youth did not
get out of the vehicle; they just opened the van door and looked at
the dog. Collateral reported there was one time there was an
issue with the facility vehicle overheating and she put coolant in
the vehicle as she is good with vehicles. Collateral reported the
youth remained in the vehicle while she did this. Collateral
reported no youth from the facility have ever been in her and Staff
1’s apartment. Collateral reported she has never seen any of the
youth from the facility smoke or vape as she does not see the
youth in that sense to know if they do that as she has only seen
them when dropping Staff 1 off or picking up from work in addition
to the time they drove by and stopped quick to see the dog and
the other time the youth were in the van when she put coolant in
the vehicle. Collateral reported she was at the park when Staff 1
has drove by with youth on their way places and waived however
has never been at the park with Staff 1 and any youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 8/27/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 3 reported when she
began working at the facility approximately one year ago it was
unclear on the purpose of therapeutic drives and some staff would
just take youth on drives for up to an hour and drive around
listening to music. Staff 3 reported clarification came out
regarding therapeutic drives and what it is meant to be is a way to
separate youth at times by taking a few youth out of the house for
10

a drive for ten to fifteen minutes. Staff 3 reported typically it is one
staff that takes up to three youth to remain in ratio however if more
than three youth go then another staff goes to maintain ratio. Staff
3 reported she has never heard anything about any staff ever
stopping at their house/apartment with youth while on therapeutic
drives or any time. Staff 3 reported the facility typically utilizes
Morey Courts for recreation. However, Morey Courts closed for a
short time and the facility began utilizing Copper Beech gym.
Staff 3 reported she had heard about the allegations. Staff 3
reported she has worked with Staff 1 and has no concerns with
Staff 1 nor has she ever witnessed any youth returning to the
facility after being with Staff 1 and appearing to be under the
influence of marijuana.
Staff 8 was interviewed via telephone on 9/11/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 8 reported she
began working at the facility in July 2025 and was able to take
youth on therapeutic drives for the first two weeks of her
employment prior to the facility determining to stop taking youth on
therapeutic drives. Staff 8 reported therapeutic drives were
intended to be used to give youth a break away from the house for
ten to fifteen minutes to listen to music and get their minds off
whatever was upsetting them. Staff 8 reported no knowledge of
any youth ever going to Copper Beech gym as when she began
working at the facility, the facility was going to Planet Fitness.
Staff 8 reported no youth have ever reported going to any staff’s
houses/apartments or being provided with vapes and/or marijuana
by any staff. Staff 8 reported she has never witnessed any youth
return from off-ground outings with staff appearing to be under the
influence of any substances. Staff 8 reported no concerns of any
staff providing youth with vapes and/or marijuana. Staff 8 reported
she did not know or ever work with Staff 4, Staff 5, or Staff 6. Staff
8 reported Youth E tends to lie about staff and approximately two
weeks ago Youth E was upset and made a general statement
regarding “the facility” letting youth use marijuana however Youth
E did not specify any specific staff. Youth E made this statement
after being interviewed regarding this special investigation.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 9/11/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 7 reported he has
worked at the facility for approximately one year. Staff 7 reported
therapeutic drives are no longer allowed at the facility, however
previously staff were able to take youth on short drives lasting
about fifteen minutes to allow youth a break away from the facility
to cool off when they were upset. Staff 7 reported the facility
stopped allowing therapeutic drives due to the intent behind the
11

therapeutic drive getting taken advantage of and occurring more
frequently than needed and lasting longer than fifteen minutes.
Staff 7 reported he rarely took youth on therapeutic drives as he is
a male staff and only able to transport youth when a female staff is
also present. Staff 7 reported no knowledge of any staff ever
taking youth to their house and/or apartment or any staff providing
youth with vapes or marijuana. Staff 7 reported youth at the
facility tend to make up allegations to get staff in trouble. Staff 7
reported Youth C made a statement back around November 2024
that she was going to tell Administrator 2 that Staff 5 let her hit her
vape in the car. Staff 7 reported Staff 5 no longer works at the
facility and quit around May 2025. Staff 7 reported he once heard
Youth D talking to another youth, unable to recall who, and Youth
D told the other youth she knew Staff 5 vaped and was going to
try to get Staff 5’s vape. Staff 7 reported he never heard Youth D
make any other statements or any other youth regarding Staff 5.
Staff 7 reported he worked with Staff 5 and never had any
concerns of Staff 5 providing vapes to youth. Staff 7 reported no
youth have alleged any staff recently allowing them to vape, or
provide youth with vapes and/or marijuana. Staff 7 reported Staff
1 is a “strong staff” and she is structured and consistent with
youth. Staff 7 reported he has never heard any concerns or
allegations of Staff 1 providing youth with vapes or marijuana.
Staff 7 reported he worked with Staff 6 for less than a month when
he began working at the facility prior to her quitting. Staff 7
reported he never heard any concerns of Staff 6 allowing,
providing, and/or Staff 6 vaping around youth. Staff 7 reported he
worked with Staff 4 for about six months prior to Staff 4 quitting.
Staff 7 reported he had no concerns with Staff 4 as she was “an
awesome staff”. Staff 7 reported he never heard or saw Staff 4
vape or use marijuana in front of youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 9/11/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Staff 5 reported she
worked at the facility from October 2024 until March or May 2025.
Staff 5 reported she never gave Youth D or any youth at the
facility a vape. Staff 5 reported Youth D asked her to bring her a
vape and she told her no. Staff 5 reported she never allowed
Youth C or any youth at the facility to use her vape. Staff 5
reported she does vape and would bring her vape to work and
lock it in her car as she would leave the facility on her break and
go down the road to use her vape, however youth were aware she
vaped as youth had seen her when she was off work vaping in her
car in the community. Staff 5 reported Youth C and Youth D
made comments about how they were going to break into her car
to steal her vape, so she began keeping her vape in her purse in a
12

locked area in the basement of the house. Staff 5 reported she
